title: Contrasts & Oppositions
description: Master expressing contrasts, oppositions, and unexpected outcomes. Perfect for B1 learners developing nuanced communication skills.

questions.sentence: Il fait beau, ___ je reste à la maison.
questions.explanation: 'Pourtant' (yet/however) expresses an unexpected contrast. The weather is nice, YET you stay home - surprising!
questions.translation: The weather is nice, yet I stay home.

questions.sentence: En France, on dit 'week-end', ___ en Québec on dit 'fin de semaine'.
questions.explanation: 'Par contre' (on the other hand) introduces a contrasting fact between two situations.
questions.translation: In France, they say 'week-end', on the other hand in Quebec they say 'fin de semaine'.

questions.sentence: Le projet est difficile. ___, c'est impossible de réussir seul.
questions.explanation: 'C'est-à-dire' (that is to say) clarifies or restates what was just said in more specific terms.
questions.translation: The project is difficult. That is to say, it's impossible to succeed alone.

questions.sentence: J'aime voyager, ___ je n'ai pas beaucoup d'argent.
questions.explanation: 'Mais' (but) is the most common way to express a direct contrast or limitation.
questions.translation: I like traveling, but I don't have much money.

questions.sentence: Il ne vient pas au cinéma, ___ il doit travailler.
questions.explanation: 'Car' (because/for) explains the reason, similar to 'parce que' but more formal and literary.
questions.translation: He's not coming to the cinema, for he has to work.

questions.sentence: Elle travaille dur. ___, elle a obtenu une promotion.
questions.explanation: 'De plus' (moreover/furthermore) adds additional information that reinforces the previous point.
questions.translation: She works hard. Moreover, she got a promotion.

questions.sentence: Ils sont opposés ___ ils se comprennent bien.
questions.explanation: 'Mais' (but) connects two contrasting ideas - they're opposed BUT they understand each other.
questions.translation: They are opposed but they understand each other well.

questions.sentence: Le film était long, ___ il était ennuyeux.
questions.explanation: 'De plus' (moreover) adds another negative aspect. The movie was long, AND ALSO it was boring.
questions.translation: The movie was long, moreover it was boring.
